citations.narrative:
There were at least 4 litters of puppies that were not listed on the Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand
(APHIS form 7005) or a cage cage placed on the primary enclosures with the correct information. Failure to keep and
maintain records of dogs and puppies on hand makes it difficult to keep track of animals. Licensee needs to keep and
maintain records of puppies under 16 weeks on APHIS form 7005 or use an appropriate cage card on the primary
enclosure to identify puppies. Correct by September 18, 2023.

Condition and Site. There were accumulations of hair and dust on the floor of the food storage room. Shelves and cart
storing veterinary supplies had accumulations of dust and clutter. Housing facilities and food storage areas must be free
of accumulations of dust, hair, and discarded items to protect supplies from contamination and pests. Correct by routinely
cleaning floors, shelves, and carts of clutter, hair, dust, and discarded items. Correct by September 18, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There were at least 4 litters of puppies that were not listed on the Record of Acquisition of Dogs and Cats on Hand 
(APHIS form 7005) or a cage cage placed on the primary enclosures with the correct information. Failure to keep and 
maintain records of dogs and puppies on hand makes it difficult to keep track of animals. Licensee needs to keep and 
maintain records of puppies under 16 weeks on APHIS form 7005 or use an appropriate cage card on the primary 
enclosure to identify puppies. Correct by September 18, 2023. 
3.1(b) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Condition and Site. There were accumulations of hair and dust on the floor of the food storage room. Shelves and cart 
storing veterinary supplies had accumulations of dust and clutter. Housing facilities and food storage areas must be free 
of accumulations of dust, hair, and discarded items to protect supplies from contamination and pests. Correct by routinely 
cleaning floors, shelves, and carts of clutter, hair, dust, and discarded items. Correct by September 18, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
